from Afra
One week later
From what I heard, Mert had postponed his Mugla vacation. Ibrahim Selim had invited him to his show, and I was waiting in front of the screen to watch him. I was going to soothe my longing for him by seeing him on screen. There was a time when I used to ease that longing by hugging him. ğŸ¥º Anyway, the show started. When Ibrahim Selim called Mert, he shouted, "Mothers' blessings, young girls' hopes, Mert Ramazan Demirrr!" I told myself loudly, "Young girls shouldn't get their hopes up, he is engaged. And girlies, I am your sister-in-law, yep, that's me." But I actually shouldâ€™ve said â€œhe was engagedâ€ not â€œhe is engagedâ€. Right now, Mert and I could still be together. Of course, if I hadn't made that stupid mistake. ğŸ¤¦â™€ï¸ğŸ¤¦â™€ï¸
One week ago (THE STUPID MISTAKE I MADE)
Talking to Mert had been good for me. Yes, just like you might imagine, nothing happened between us after that incident, after the kiss. Mert had dropped me off at home. Everything seemed normal, but then I received a message from an unknown number. The message was:
-"I know who killed Merih."
That's exactly what the message said. Of course, I was worried. Merih was my closest friend. A few years ago, she had been murdered, but the police had covered it up, claiming it was an accident. I didn't believe them and had spent a year chasing the case, but since I couldnâ€™t find anything, I finally gave up.
But I believed this message. So, I wrote back:
-"Who killed her?" I wanted to see what they would ask in return. I was sure they were going to ask for money, and sure enough, they did. They asked for 10,000 TRY. Unfortunately, I stupidly believed them and sent it. The person then said:
